concept.title: Causes of Engine Knocking
concept.shortdesc: Understanding the various causes of engine knocking and the importance of prompt professional diagnosis.

conbody.p: Engine knocking can occur due to several different mechanical issues. Early identification and professional repair are essential for preventing further damage.

ul.li:
Carbon knock
Most frequent cause
Results from cylinder carbonization

Advanced spark timing
Occurs when spark timing is set too early in the cycle

Connecting rod issues
Creates distinctive knocking sound

Crankshaft main bearing problems
Related to bearing wear or damage

Piston problems
Can be caused by loose-fitting piston
May result from broken piston rings

Cylinder head gasket contact
Occurs when piston strikes the gasket

section.title: Professional Assessment
section.p: When engine knocking occurs, regardless of the suspected cause, immediate inspection by a qualified mechanic is necessary to diagnose and address the underlying problem.
